English[edit]

Proper noun[edit]

Auto

  1. An unincorporated community in West Virginia

Anagrams[edit]

  • aout, outa

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

Shortened from Automobil, from French automobile.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈaʊ̯toː/, [ˈʔaʊ̯tʰoː]
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • Audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Auto n (genitive Autos, plural Autos)

  1. car
    Das ist das Auto meines Vaters.
    That is my father’s car.

Hunsrik[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • auto (Wiesemann spelling system)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈaʊ̯to/

Noun[edit]

Auto n (plural Autos)

  1. car
    Er hod en neies Auto kaafd.
    He bought a new car.

Synonyms[edit]

  • Karre
